PipeOpFilter

Source: R/PipeOpFilter.R

Feature filtering using a mlr3featsel::Filter object, see the mlr3featsel package.

The settings of the filter are given as paradox::ParamUty; when Filters start supporting the paradox interface that could be used instead.

If a Filter can only operate on a subset of columns based on column type, then only these features are considered. nfeat and frac will count for the features of the type that the Filter can operate on; this means e.g. that setting nfeat to 0 will only remove features of the type that the Filter can work with.

PipeOpFilter

Format

R6Class object inheriting from PipeOpTaskPreprocSimple.

Methods

  • PipeOpFilter$new(filter, id = filter$id, param_vals = list())
    (mlr3featsel::Filter, character(1), list) -> self
    Constructor. filter gives the Filter to use.

Parameter Set

  • settings :: named list
    List of settings to be given to the Filter. Default list().

  • nfeat :: numeric(1)
    Number of features to select. If this is set, frac and cutoff` must not be set.

  • frac :: numeric(1)
    Fraction of features to keep. If this is set, nfeat and cutoff must not be set.

  • cutoff :: numeric(1)
    Minimum value of filter heuristic for which to keep features. If this is set, nfeat and frac must not be set.

See also

Other PipeOps: PipeOpEnsemble, PipeOpTaskPreproc, PipeOp, mlr_pipeop_NULL, mlr_pipeop_backup_learner, mlr_pipeop_balancesample, mlr_pipeop_branch, mlr_pipeop_chunk, mlr_pipeop_copy, mlr_pipeop_encode, mlr_pipeop_featureunion, mlr_pipeop_impute, mlr_pipeop_learner, mlr_pipeop_majorityvote, mlr_pipeop_modelavg, mlr_pipeop_nloptmajorityvote, mlr_pipeop_pca, mlr_pipeop_scale, mlr_pipeop_subsample, mlr_pipeop_unbranch, mlr_pipeops
